title: Indonesia: Floods, landslides kill 31 in North Sumatra
Aleppo's unrest: What the rebel offensive means for Syria and Middle East
content: Rebels have seized control of significant areas in Aleppo, marking the most severe fighting in the region in years. The Syrian observatory reports rapid capture, although state media denies these claims. Government forces, backed by Russian airpower, retaliated with airstrikes and detentions. The UN reports a dire humanitarian situation, with hospitals reaching capacity. The resurgence of conflict highlights the Syrian regime's vulnerabilities.
summary: Rebels have seized control of significant areas in Aleppo, marking the most severe fighting in the region in years. The Syrian observatory reports rapid capture, although state media denies these claims. Government forces, backed by Russian airpower, retaliated with airstrikes and detentions. The UN reports a dire humanitarian situation, with hospitals reaching capacity. The resurgence of conflict highlights the Syrian regime's vulnerabilities.

title: Canada PM Trudeau meets Trump as US president-elect threatens to impose tariffs
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's unannounced visit to Florida involved a dinner meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump following Trump's announcement of planned tariffs on Canadian imports. Trudeau is the first G7 leader to meet Trump since the November election.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's unannounced visit to Florida involved a dinner meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump following Trump's announcement of planned tariffs on Canadian imports. Trudeau is the first G7 leader to meet Trump since the November election.

title: Watch: Military vehicle mows down woman protesting rigged elections in Mozambique
content: A military vehicle in Maputo ran over a woman during protests over alleged election fraud. The woman suffered head injuries but is stable. Mozambique's armed forces expressed regret and pledged to cover her medical costs. In another incident, police killed two protesters in Nampula. The unrest followed the disputed October 9 election result, leading to at least 67 deaths.
summary: A military vehicle in Maputo ran over a woman during protests over alleged election fraud. The woman suffered head injuries but is stable. Mozambique's armed forces expressed regret and pledged to cover her medical costs. In another incident, police killed two protesters in Nampula. The unrest followed the disputed October 9 election result, leading to at least 67 deaths.

title: 'Barron is very smart': Elon Musk's mother says he and Trump's son were talking all night
content: US President-elect Donald Trump hosted a Thanksgiving dinner at Mar-a-Lago, Florida, with notable guests like Elon Musk and his mother, Maye Musk. Highlights included discussions between Musk and Trump’s son Barron, and a festive atmosphere with guests dancing to “YMCA.” Hollywood star Sylvester Stallone also attended.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump hosted a Thanksgiving dinner at Mar-a-Lago, Florida, with notable guests like Elon Musk and his mother, Maye Musk. Highlights included discussions between Musk and Trump’s son Barron, and a festive atmosphere with guests dancing to “YMCA.” Hollywood star Sylvester Stallone also attended.

title: 'These sources have no idea': GOP spokesperson rejects reports of Trump transgender military ban
content: President-elect Trump is reportedly planning to ban transgender individuals from the military, affecting around 15,000 personnel. His incoming press secretary denies any definitive decisions. Fox News host Pete Hegseth, Trump's choice for Defence Secretary, has criticized 'wokeism' in the military. Trump previously attempted a similar ban in 2017, reversed by Biden in 2019.
summary: President-elect Trump is reportedly planning to ban transgender individuals from the military, affecting around 15,000 personnel. His incoming press secretary denies any definitive decisions. Fox News host Pete Hegseth, Trump's choice for Defence Secretary, has criticized 'wokeism' in the military. Trump previously attempted a similar ban in 2017, reversed by Biden in 2019.

title: 'They arrived unprovoked': Mob attacks three Hindu temples in Bangladesh amid protests
content: In Chattogram, Bangladesh, three Hindu temples were attacked by a mob on Friday following sedition charges against a former Iskcon member. Authorities reported damage to the Shani Temple and other temples' gates. Tensions rose after Chinmoy Krishna Das's arrest for allegedly disrespecting Bangladesh's national flag. India expressed concerns, urging protection for minorities, while Bangladesh sought safety assurances for its diplomatic missions.
summary: In Chattogram, Bangladesh, three Hindu temples were attacked by a mob on Friday following sedition charges against a former Iskcon member. Authorities reported damage to the Shani Temple and other temples' gates. Tensions rose after Chinmoy Krishna Das's arrest for allegedly disrespecting Bangladesh's national flag. India expressed concerns, urging protection for minorities, while Bangladesh sought safety assurances for its diplomatic missions.

title: Japan to prosecute dead girl after suicide attempt kills another woman
content: A 17-year-old girl from Japan jumped from the 12th floor of a shopping complex, landing on 32-year-old Chikako Chiba, resulting in both their deaths. The teenager, thought to have committed suicide, has been charged posthumously. This incident has sparked debate over prosecuting the deceased. Japan struggles with high teenage suicide rates, especially on September 1.
summary: A 17-year-old girl from Japan jumped from the 12th floor of a shopping complex, landing on 32-year-old Chikako Chiba, resulting in both their deaths. The teenager, thought to have committed suicide, has been charged posthumously. This incident has sparked debate over prosecuting the deceased. Japan struggles with high teenage suicide rates, especially on September 1.

title: 'Darkest election possible': Bill Clinton apologises for 'outbursts' after wife Hillary's 2016 loss to Trump
content: Bill Clinton revealed he struggled with anger and sleeplessness for two years after Hillary Clinton's loss in the 2016 presidential election. He blamed Russian interference, the FBI, and media. Clinton also addressed his ties to Jeffrey Epstein and regrets his response in the Monica Lewinsky scandal.
summary: Bill Clinton revealed he struggled with anger and sleeplessness for two years after Hillary Clinton's loss in the 2016 presidential election. He blamed Russian interference, the FBI, and media. Clinton also addressed his ties to Jeffrey Epstein and regrets his response in the Monica Lewinsky scandal.

title: Trump's defence secretary pick Pete Hegseth accused of abuse, infidelity by own mother
content: Amid his nomination for US defence secretary, Pete Hegseth faces accusations from his mother, Penelope, about mistreating women. Despite her later apology, concerns rise over his personal conduct, including infidelity and a rape complaint. Supporters and critics remain divided as the scrutiny intensifies, especially given the military's strict stance on such issues.
summary: Amid his nomination for US defence secretary, Pete Hegseth faces accusations from his mother, Penelope, about mistreating women. Despite her later apology, concerns rise over his personal conduct, including infidelity and a rape complaint. Supporters and critics remain divided as the scrutiny intensifies, especially given the military's strict stance on such issues.

title: Crypto boss who bought a $6 million banana offers to buy 100,000 more
Did Biden's border policies cost Democrats the White House? Party members blame ‘political malpractice'
content: Democrats reflected on their loss, admitting President Biden’s border policies alienated voters and helped Trump regain the presidency. Critics pointed to halted border wall construction and paused deportations as key factors. Warnings from party insiders about voter concerns were ignored, leading to significant support for Trump in Hispanic areas due to his strong stance on immigration and crime.
summary: Democrats reflected on their loss, admitting President Biden’s border policies alienated voters and helped Trump regain the presidency. Critics pointed to halted border wall construction and paused deportations as key factors. Warnings from party insiders about voter concerns were ignored, leading to significant support for Trump in Hispanic areas due to his strong stance on immigration and crime.

title: Buyer eats $6.2 million banana art: 'Better than others'
Honeymoon horror: Newlywed bride mysteriously found dead in Miami
content: A Polish bride's honeymoon in Miami turned tragic when she died 23 days after her wedding. Aleksandra Leczycka and her husband were found unconscious, suspected initially of being drugged and robbed. A re-investigation revealed she likely consumed psychoactive substances voluntarily, leading to her death. Aleksandra's husband has not commented on the incident.
summary: A Polish bride's honeymoon in Miami turned tragic when she died 23 days after her wedding. Aleksandra Leczycka and her husband were found unconscious, suspected initially of being drugged and robbed. A re-investigation revealed she likely consumed psychoactive substances voluntarily, leading to her death. Aleksandra's husband has not commented on the incident.

title: ‘Coordinated psy-op’: Elon Musk echoes Joe Rogan’s defence of Trump
content: Elon Musk defended President-elect Donald Trump, branding criticism against him as a "coordinated psychological operation". Musk echoed podcast host Joe Rogan's claims that backlash towards Trump is orchestrated to distort public perception. Rogan suggested that differing treatment of political figures reveals hypocrisy. Both Musk and Rogan have publicly supported Trump, amplifying these perspectives to their massive audiences.
summary: Elon Musk defended President-elect Donald Trump, branding criticism against him as a "coordinated psychological operation". Musk echoed podcast host Joe Rogan's claims that backlash towards Trump is orchestrated to distort public perception. Rogan suggested that differing treatment of political figures reveals hypocrisy. Both Musk and Rogan have publicly supported Trump, amplifying these perspectives to their massive audiences.

title: Is Congresswoman AOC planning for 2028 US presidential bid? Netizens react
content: Speculation about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez running for president in 2028 has intensified, with The Hill highlighting her grassroots appeal. While praised for her authenticity, some strategists and critics question her progressive approach and rapid push for change. Her potential impact remains a topic of debate.

title: Another MAGA podcast? Joe Rogan hints at Mar-a-Lago podcast episode with Trump
content: Joe Rogan considers recording an episode of his podcast from Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate, discussing the idea with comedians and having spoken to Donald Trump Jr. The podcast drew huge numbers when Trump appeared previously, and Rogan has been known for controversial podcast decisions.
summary: Joe Rogan considers recording an episode of his podcast from Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate, discussing the idea with comedians and having spoken to Donald Trump Jr. The podcast drew huge numbers when Trump appeared previously, and Rogan has been known for controversial podcast decisions.

title: Boat capsizes in Nigeria: 27 dead, over 100 missing
content: At least 27 people have died, and over 100 are missing after a boat capsized on the River Niger in northern Nigeria. The vessel was carrying around 200 people, mostly women heading to a food market. Overloading appears to be a major factor, highlighting the ongoing safety issues with water transportation in Nigeria. Rescue efforts faced challenges, with teams struggling to locate the capsizing site hours after the incident, said Justin Uwazuruonye from Nigeria's National Emergency Management Agency.
summary: At least 27 people have died, and over 100 are missing after a boat capsized on the River Niger in northern Nigeria. The vessel was carrying around 200 people, mostly women heading to a food market. Overloading appears to be a major factor, highlighting the ongoing safety issues with water transportation in Nigeria. Rescue efforts faced challenges, with teams struggling to locate the capsizing site hours after the incident, said Justin Uwazuruonye from Nigeria's National Emergency Management Agency.

title: Supermodel Luciana Curtis, family kidnapped at gunpoint, held hostage in shack
content: Brazilian model Luciana Curtis, her husband, and their child experienced a 12-hour kidnapping ordeal in São Paulo after armed men abducted them outside a restaurant. They were held hostage in a shack while money was transferred from their accounts. Police intervention led to their safe release.
summary: Brazilian model Luciana Curtis, her husband, and their child experienced a 12-hour kidnapping ordeal in São Paulo after armed men abducted them outside a restaurant. They were held hostage in a shack while money was transferred from their accounts. Police intervention led to their safe release.

title: Cucumbers recalled due to salmonella risk in multiple US states and Canada
content: SunFed recalls bulk shipments of fresh cucumbers across 26 US states and five Canadian provinces due to potential salmonella contamination. The affected cucumbers were sold between October 12 and November 26, 2024. Consumers are urged to check for the recall and avoid consuming potentially contaminated cucumbers.
summary: SunFed recalls bulk shipments of fresh cucumbers across 26 US states and five Canadian provinces due to potential salmonella contamination. The affected cucumbers were sold between October 12 and November 26, 2024. Consumers are urged to check for the recall and avoid consuming potentially contaminated cucumbers.
